snippet: The organization found no network “excellent” in its diversity, but most of the biggest networks were found to be “good,” according to a new report.
abstract: Glaad, formerly known as the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation, releases study finding that no television network is 'excellent' in its representation of gays and lesbians, but most of nation's biggest networks earn grade of 'good.'
lead_paragraph: The organization found no network “excellent” in its diversity, but most of the biggest networks were found to be “good,” according to a new report.

headline.main: Glaad Sees Improvement in Depictions of Gays and Lesbians on TV
headline.print_headline: Better Ratings for TV From Gay Rights Group

keywords.value: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation
keywords.name: organizations
